63  def update(self, x, y, yaw):
64 
65  #set parameters for motion
66 
67  self.particle_updates = []
68 
69  self.motion_model.setMotion(x,y,yaw)
70 
71 
72 
73  #calculate weights after motion
74 
75  for i in range(self.particle_set_size):
76 
77  # for i in range(self.random_particles_size):

90 
91  weight_sum = 0.0
92 
93  for i in range(self.particle_set_size):
94 
95  self.particles[i].weight = weights[i]
96 
97  weight_sum += self.particles[i].weight
98 
99 
100 
101  weight_pmf = []
102 
103  if(weight_sum<1e-5):
104 
105  weight_sum=0.001
106 
107  self.particles.sort(reverse=True,key=lambda particles: particles.weight)
108 
109  for i in range(self.particle_set_size):
110 
111  self.particles[i].weight = weights[i]/weight_sum
112 
113 
114 
115  weight_pmf.append(self.particles[i].weight)
116 
117 
118 
119  resampling_size = self.particle_set_size - self.random_particles_size

121  self.particles = self.resampling(self.particles,resampling_size,weights)
122 
123 
124 
125  for i in range(self.random_particles_size):
126 
127  self.particles.append(self.random_particle_generator.generate_particle())

131  def resampling(self, particle_set, resampling_size,weight_pmf):
132 
133  cdf = np.cumsum(weight_pmf)
134 
135  samples=[]
136 
137  for i in range(resampling_size):
138 
139  r = np.random.rand()
140 
141  # idx = np.where(cdf > r)[0][0]
142 
143  a=np.random.randint(0,len(particle_set)-1)
144 
145  samples.append(self.particles[a])
146 
147 
148 
149  return samples

163  '''
164 
165  ============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
166 
167  Instructions: do one complete update of the particle filter. It should
168 
169  generate new particle set based on the given motion
170 
171  parameters and the old particle set, compute the weights of
172 
173  the particles, resample the set, and update the private
174 
175  member field that holds the current best pose estimate
176 
177  (self.pose_estimate). Note that the motion parameters provided
178 
179  to this function are in robot's reference frame.
180 
181 
182 
183  Hint: Check motion_model.py for documentation and example how to use it
184 
185  for the particle pose update.
186 
187  x, y, yaw -- are the odometry update of the robot's pose (increments)
188 
189 
190 
191 
192 
193  Remark: to compute the weight of particles, use the weigh_particles_callback member
194 
195  field:
196 
197 
198 
199  weights = self.weigh_particles_callback(particles_list)
200 
201 
202 
203  Remark: to generate a comletely random particle use the provided
204 
205  random_particle_generator object:
206 
207 
208 
209  particle = self.random_particle_generator.generate_particle()
210 
211 
212 
213  Finally the best pose estimate and assign it to the corresponding member field
214 
215  for visualization:
216 
217  self.pose_estimate = selected_particle.pose
218 
219  ============================================================================
